channel.title: 纽约时报 > 图书 > 书评

item.title: 测试一下这些 2024 年电影改编作品中使用的书籍
item.description: 随着一年的结束，最后一部热门电影也已上映——这五部电影主要改编自回忆录和传记。试试这个测试，看看您知道多少。

item.title: 热爱蓝调的音乐记者斯坦利·布斯去世，享年 82 岁
item.description: 他最出名的作品是有关滚石乐队的书。但他写的大多是布鲁斯歌手，其中一些很有名（B.B. King），也有一些名气不大（Furry Lewis）。

item.title: 吉米·卡特：诗人、小说家、回忆录作家、哲学家
item.description: 他不仅著作颇丰，出版了 32 本书。他的作品范围也十分广泛，包括回忆录、历史小说甚至诗歌。

item.title: 怀有一子并说了 295,233 个词
item.description: 在她生孩子前的几个月里，我们的评论家写了很多东西。当动笔写作的冲动变得极端时会发生什么？

item.title: 吉米·卡特也是一位狂热的读者
item.description: 总统是一位狂热的读者，喜欢诗歌、南北战争历史和南方小说。他还给埃里卡·荣格寄了一封粉丝信。

item.title: 关于吉米·卡特的生平、总统生涯和声誉的书籍
item.description: 多年来，这位第 39 任总统很少受到作家的关注。但最近，一些书籍试图重新评价他的声誉。下面是不断扩大的卡特图书馆。

item.title: 走进马尔克斯笔下的现实版马孔多
item.description: 在前往哥伦比亚观看 Netflix 制作的《百年孤独》时，一位记者被一些真实地方的记忆所震撼。

item.title: 童眼中的集中营记录者米歇尔·德尔·卡斯蒂略逝世，享年 91 岁
item.description: 他 24 岁时出版的第一部小说《Tanguy》是一个基于事实的大屠杀故事，一位评论家称其“从安妮·弗兰克的日记结束的地方开始”。

item.title: 让艺术家的缪斯女神重回舞台的露丝·巴特勒逝世，​​享年 93 岁
item.description: 在出版了罗丹的权威传记后，她继续描写了那些为 19 世纪法国艺术巨匠担任模特的未被充分重视的女性。

item.title: 出版业最热门趋势：从封面判断书籍
item.description: 精心设计、带有图案边缘和其他效果的书籍最初是浪漫和幻想小说中的一种潮流，现在已经蔓延到整个出版业。

item.title: 找到你的下一本最爱的书
item.description: 书评编辑精选的读物，保证适合任何心情。

item.title: 2024 年读者喜爱的书籍
item.description: 令人难忘的人物、令人愉快的非小说作品和令人感伤的小说让世界各地的人们难以忘怀。

item.title: 《纽约时报》员工谈 2024 年他们喜欢的书籍
item.description: 一本打破禁忌的布鲁克林回忆录、一本讲述联系之美的温柔日本小说、一本由死亡助产士撰写的书：来自新闻编辑室各地的编辑和作家描述了他们今年最喜欢的书籍。

item.title: 2024 年 100 本值得关注的书籍
item.description: 以下是《纽约时报书评》工作人员评选出的本年度值得关注的小说、诗歌和非小说类图书。

item.title: 2024 年 10 部最佳图书
item.description: 《纽约时报书评》的工作人员评选出了年度最佳小说和非小说类图书。

item.title: Test Yourself on the Books Used in These 2024 Film Adaptations
item.description: As the year winds down, the last of the big buzzy films have hit the screen — and these five were based largely on memoirs and biographies. Try this quiz to see how many you know.

item.title: Test Yourself on the Books Used in These 2024 Film Adaptations
item.description: As the year winds down, the last of the big buzzy films have hit the screen — and these five were based largely on memoirs and biographies. Try this quiz to see how many you know.

item.title: Stanley Booth, Music Journalist Who Loved the Blues, Dies at 82
item.description: He is best known for his book about the Rolling Stones. But he mostly wrote about blues artists, some of them famous (B.B. King) and some less renowned (Furry Lewis).

item.title: Stanley Booth, Music Journalist Who Loved the Blues, Dies at 82
item.description: He is best known for his book about the Rolling Stones. But he mostly wrote about blues artists, some of them famous (B.B. King) and some less renowned (Furry Lewis).

item.title: In a Political Year, Some Deaths Spoke to the Struggles for Democracy
item.description: Among the notable figures who died in a sometimes polarizing 2024, many championed justice, equal rights and political freedom.

item.title: In a Political Year, Some Deaths Spoke to the Struggles for Democracy
item.description: Among the notable figures who died in a sometimes polarizing 2024, many championed justice, equal rights and political freedom.

item.title: Jimmy Carter: Poet, Novelist, Memoirist, Philosopher
item.description: He wasn’t just prolific, publishing 32 books. His output also showed an unusual range that included memoirs and forays into historical fiction and even poetry.

item.title: Jimmy Carter: Poet, Novelist, Memoirist, Philosopher
item.description: He wasn’t just prolific, publishing 32 books. His output also showed an unusual range that included memoirs and forays into historical fiction and even poetry.

item.title: Pregnant With One Child and 295,233 Words
item.description: During the months before she gave birth, our critic wrote — a lot. What happens when the impulse to put pen to paper becomes extreme?

item.title: Pregnant With One Child and 295,233 Words
item.description: During the months before she gave birth, our critic wrote — a lot. What happens when the impulse to put pen to paper becomes extreme?

item.title: Jimmy Carter Was Also a Voracious Reader
item.description: A voracious reader, the president liked poetry, Civil War history and Southern fiction. He also sent Erica Jong a fan letter.

item.title: Jimmy Carter Was Also a Voracious Reader
item.description: A voracious reader, the president liked poetry, Civil War history and Southern fiction. He also sent Erica Jong a fan letter.

item.title: Books to Read About Jimmy Carter’s Life, Presidency and Reputation
item.description: For many years, the 39th president generated little attention from authors. But recently books have sought to re-evaluate his reputation. Here is a look at the expanding Carter library.

item.title: Books to Read About Jimmy Carter’s Life, Presidency and Reputation
item.description: For many years, the 39th president generated little attention from authors. But recently books have sought to re-evaluate his reputation. Here is a look at the expanding Carter library.

item.title: Going to a Real-Life Version of Gabriel García Márquez’s Macondo
item.description: On a trip to Colombia to see the Netflix production of “One Hundred Years of Solitude,” a reporter was struck by memories of real places.

item.title: Going to a Real-Life Version of Gabriel García Márquez’s Macondo
item.description: On a trip to Colombia to see the Netflix production of “One Hundred Years of Solitude,” a reporter was struck by memories of real places.

item.title: Michel del Castillo, 91, Dies; Child’s-Eye Chronicler of Concentration Camps
item.description: His first novel, “Tanguy,” published when he was 24, was a fact-based Holocaust story that one reviewer said “begins where Anne Frank’s diary ended.”

item.title: Michel del Castillo, 91, Dies; Child’s-Eye Chronicler of Concentration Camps
item.description: His first novel, “Tanguy,” published when he was 24, was a fact-based Holocaust story that one reviewer said “begins where Anne Frank’s diary ended.”

item.title: 5 New Books We Recommend This Week
item.description: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.

item.title: 5 New Books We Recommend This Week
item.description: Suggested reading from critics and editors at The New York Times.

item.title: Ruth Butler, Who Brought Artists’ Muses to Life, Dies at 93
item.description: After publishing a definitive biography of Rodin, she went on to write about the underappreciated women who modeled for the giants of 19th-century French art.

item.title: Ruth Butler, Who Brought Artists’ Muses to Life, Dies at 93
item.description: After publishing a definitive biography of Rodin, she went on to write about the underappreciated women who modeled for the giants of 19th-century French art.

item.title: The Hottest Trend in Publishing: Books You Can Judge by Their Cover
item.description: Elaborately designed books with patterned edges and other effects started as a trend in romance and fantasy, and have now spread throughout the publishing industry.

item.title: The Hottest Trend in Publishing: Books You Can Judge by Their Cover
item.description: Elaborately designed books with patterned edges and other effects started as a trend in romance and fantasy, and have now spread throughout the publishing industry.

item.title: Book Review: ‘Tumblebaby,’ by Adam Rex, and ‘Meeselphe,’ by Claude Ponti
item.description: Our reviewer read these stories on a train, as the world rolled by out the window.

item.title: Robert Coover’s Outrageous 1977 Novel About U.S. Politics, Is Even More Relevant Now
item.description: Robert Coover’s “The Public Burning” was met with bafflement and awe when it appeared in 1977. Reality has finally caught up to his masterpiece.
